lumaCalculation

Class LumaModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • lumaCalculation.LumaModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<java.awt.Color>

    public class LumaModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<java.awt.Color>
    A 'LumaModel' represents a luminosity mathematical function that is based upon a weighted sum of the R-G-B values for a color.
    Author:
    aarongaba

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double blueWeight
      The weight of the blue component in the RGB color space

      The weight of the green component in the RGB color space
      private double redWeight
      The weight of red component in the RGB color space

    • Constructor Detail

      • LumaModel

        public LumaModel(double redWeight,
                 double greenWeight,
                 double blueWeight)
        Constructs a luminosity mathematical functions with the given R-G-B weights. Each weight must be non-negative and their sum must be one.
        Parameters:
        redWeight - - The weight of the red component
        greenWeight - - The weight of the green component
        blueWeight - - The weight of the blue component

        public double computeLuma(java.awt.Color myColor)
        Given a color, compute its (perceived) luminosity.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        luma - The (perceived) luminosity of the given color.

      • compare

        public int compare(java.awt.Color o1,
                   java.awt.Color o2)
        Compares two colors based upon their computed luma values. Returns 1, if o1's luma is greater than o2's, 0, if their luma are equal, -1 otherwise
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<java.awt.Color>
